channel.title: Does anyone know the different between to and too?
channel.description:
I noticed this a lot on the forums and everywhere else for that matter. Does anyone know the different between the word "to" and "too"?
Here it is everyone. SO GET IT RIGHT! lol. The word "to" is used when you want TO go somewhere, you want TO hump something, you want TO eat something, or whatever.
You DO NOT use the word "to" when you mean also. Such as... Oh my god! I eat food [u]to[/u]! - WRONG!!!!
Oh my god! I eat food [u]too[/u]! - CORRECT!!!!
You use the word TOO with TWO o's when you are saying "also". I do this too, he did this too, she played with that too.
Just thought I would clear it up, since it was bugging the hell out of me.
~Ron

item.title: Does anyone know the different between to and too?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“kuiren2, post:15, topic:3290”]what about the L (PL)ease
(PL)0x[/quote]
I hate that word!!! Pl0x… WTF!!! It’s please. God I really hate LEET altogether. Yeah and the other guys are right, “ur”, “there”, and “know” vs “no” is also agravating. Why don’t people know more, are their brains there?

Do they know the difference between the word “then” and “than”?

Then = Next … Example: Then, we beat the shit out of this kid.
Than = Comparison … Example: That kid was bloodier than my mom giving birth.

Rawr!!!

~Ron

Read full topic
